2.speaker: voice
2.definition: We are currently conducting a phone survey.

3.speaker: voice
3.character: 自動音声に従って質問にお答えください
3.definition: Please give your answers after the automated questions.

4.speaker: polar bear
4.character: あなたは 最近寝不足でお悩みですか
4.definition: Have you been suffering from a lack of sleep lately?

5.speaker: grizzly
5.definition: I know it's you, Polar Bear!

7.speaker: polar bear
7.character: この前 起きたばかりなのにまた寝てるの
7.definition: You just woke up recently, and you're asleep again?

8.speaker: grizzly
8.character: ああ 冬眠の二度寝だ
8.definition: Yeah, I went back to bed to hibernate.

9.speaker: polar bear
9.character: 二度寝じゃないでしょ

10.speaker: polar bear
10.character: もう八度寝くらいだよ
10.definition: You've gone back about eight times.

11.speaker: grizzly
11.character: お前が 何度も起こすからだろ
11.definition: Because you keep waking me up!

14.speaker: grizzly
14.definition: You really need to... ...stop that, damn it!

17.speaker: grizzly mama
17.character: もう 乱暴な言葉遣いはおよしなさい
17.definition: You really need to stop with the harsh speech.

18.speaker: grizzly mama
18.definition: Here, I brought you a gift. I-I always tell you to let me know when you're coming.

22.speaker: grizzly
22.character: グリちゃんはいい加減やめてくれよ
22.definition: I asked you not to call me that anymore. Maple syrup and Alaskan salmon!

26.speaker: grizzly mama
26.character: やっぱり 我が家は落ち着くわね
26.definition: Being at home really is relaxing.

27.speaker: grizzly mama
27.character: このまま住んじゃおうかしら

28.speaker: grizzly
28.character: 冗談だろ じいちゃんの生まれ故郷で
28.definition: Please. You were the one who moved overseas,

29.speaker: grizzly
29.character: ロハスな田舎暮らしをするって海外移住したくせに
29.definition: so you could have a LOHAS-style county life where grandpa was born.

30.speaker: grizzly mama
30.character: どう 本場のメープルシロップは
30.definition: Well? How does the authentic maple syrup taste?

31.speaker: grizzly mama
31.character: 春に収穫した旬のものよ

33.speaker: grizzly mama
33.character: あら お客様かしらあ…
33.definition: Oh? It looks like you've got a visitor. Oh, don't worry about it, Mom. I'll get it.

36.speaker: grizzly
36.character: それは 広島だろうが
36.definition: That's Hiroshima! What are you up to {\i1}(nanimon){\i0}?!

37.speaker: grizzly
37.character: それは イロモンだ

39.speaker: grizzly mama
39.definition: And this is for hot pot {\i1}(nabemono){\i0}! Hello, Polar Bear.

40.speaker: polar bear
40.character: あっ どうも ご無沙汰してます
40.definition: Oh, hello. It's been a very long time.

41.speaker: baby emp
41.character: お花見電車が通過しま～す
41.definition: The cherry blossom viewing train is coming through!

44.speaker: polar bear
44.character: 鍋ではなく ムニエルにしてみました
44.definition: I made it meunière instead of in a hot pot.

46.speaker: panda mama
46.character: いいの 私たちまでいただいちゃって
46.definition: Are you sure we can have some, as well?

47.speaker: grizzly mama
47.character: どうぞ めしあがってください

50.speaker: king
50.character: うん さすが本場産の天然物だわね
50.definition: Nothing better than getting fish fresh from its natural habitat.

51.speaker: panda mama
51.character: それにしてもグリズリーさんのお母さんにしては
51.definition: But, my, you seem rather young to be Mr. Grizzly's mother.

53.speaker: king
53.character: 失礼ですけど おいくつ
53.definition: I hope you don't mind me asking, but how old are you?

54.speaker: grizzly mama
54.definition: Oh? Well, this year... I'm seventeen.

56.speaker: panda mama
56.definition: What? You don't look it at all!

59.speaker: king
59.character: 毛並みも艶やかで 若々しいわ
59.definition: Your fur is so sleek and youthful!

60.speaker: panda mama
60.character: キューティクルの秘訣 教えてくださらない
60.definition: Could you tell me your secret behind your cuticles?

61.speaker: grizzly mama
61.character: いえ 特別なことは何も
61.definition: Oh, I don't do anything special, really.

62.speaker: king
62.character: あら 田中さん どうしたの
62.definition: What's the matter, Ms. Tanaka? Oh... It's just I'm the oldest...

63.speaker: penguin
63.character: はじめまして ペンギンです
63.definition: Nice to meet you. I'm Penguin.

64.speaker: panda
64.definition: I'm Panda. I'm always taking care of Mr. Grizzly.

65.speaker: panda mama
65.character: 違うでしょ 「お世話になってます」でしょ
65.definition: No, you mean that he's always taking care of you...

66.speaker: grizzly mama
66.character: はじめまして グリちゃんの母です
66.definition: Nice to meet you. I'm Little Grizz's mother.

68.speaker: grizzly
68.character: 母さん余計なこと言うんじゃねえ

70.speaker: sasako
70.character: へえ～ グリちゃんですか

71.speaker: baby emp
71.character: ご乗車の方はお急ぎくださ～い
71.definition: All passengers please hurry on board.

75.speaker: king
75.definition: We'll come again. Thank you for the food.

77.speaker: grizzly
77.character: じゃあ 俺は店に行くから
77.definition: Well, I'm going to the bar, so you can head home.

78.speaker: baby emp
78.character: じゃあ 俺は店に行くから

80.speaker: baby emp
80.definition: {\a6}See you later! Do your best at work. Yeah.

81.speaker: grizzly
81.character: まったく 調子狂うぜ
81.definition: Jeez... This is totally throwing things off.

82.speaker: grizzly
82.character: 久しぶりに打ってから行くか
82.definition: Guess I'll knock a few out before I head in.

83.speaker: grizzly
83.character: ふぅ～ スッキリしたぜ
83.definition: Man, that felt great! Sorry to leave you with the bar, Otter.

87.speaker: grizzly
87.character: 母さん なんでいるんだ

89.speaker: grizzly
89.character: カワウソ どういうことだ

90.speaker: otter
90.character: いやぁ 助かるでやんす
90.definition: She's been a lot of help.

91.speaker: tiger
91.character: マスター 寝不足なんだって
91.definition: I heard you're not sleeping well.

92.speaker: lion
92.character: 代わりに店に立ってくれるなんて

93.speaker: lion
93.character: いいおふくろさんじゃない
93.definition: to help you with the bar.

94.speaker: wolf
94.character: ママ ふきのとうの春巻きおいしいよ
94.definition: These fuki bud spring rolls are delicious.

96.speaker: tiger
96.character: ママ 助六寿司もうまいぜ
96.definition: The inari and roll sushi plate is great, too.

98.speaker: lion
98.character: ママ 味噌汁おかわり
98.definition: Could I get another miso soup?

100.speaker: lion
100.character: ただの味噌汁じゃねえよな

102.speaker: three
102.definition: Mom! Who asked you to make healthy family cooking?

103.speaker: grizzly
103.character: うちは 小料理屋じゃねえ

105.speaker: grizzly mama
105.character: じゃあ マスターも来たし私は帰るわね
105.definition: Well, the bar keep is back, so I'll head home.

106.speaker: grizzly mama
106.character: 皆さんこれからもグリズリーバーをごひいきに
106.definition: Everyone, please keep visiting Grizzly's Bar.

113.speaker: aligator
113.character: たまにはこういう味もいいよね
113.definition: This isn't bad once in a while.

115.speaker: otter
115.character: ママ ジンライムおかわりでやんす
115.definition: Could I get another gin lime?

117.speaker: chin
117.character: このイワシの生姜煮  絶品だよ ママ

118.speaker: grizzly mama
118.character: ありがとうございます

119.speaker: donkey
119.character: だし巻き卵も美味ですね
119.definition: The Japanese style omelettes are wonderful, too. Bar keep, this is the owner of the bakery I'm training at, Ms. Donkey.

121.speaker: wolf
121.character: 店長 これを使って和風の惣菜パンを作りませんか
121.definition: Why don't we try to make a Japanese style bakery dish with these?

122.speaker: donkey
122.character: だし巻きサンド いいですね
122.definition: Japanese style omelette sandwiches? Sounds great.

124.speaker: polar bear
124.character: スコッチ おかわり

125.speaker: penguin
125.character: グリちゃん シャンディガフ
125.definition: Could I get another Shandygaff, Little Grizz?

126.speaker: panda
126.character: 笹ジュース グリちゃん
126.definition: I want bamboo grass juice, Little Grizz.

128.speaker: sasako
128.character: カルーアミルクください グリちゃん
128.definition: Could I get a Kahlua milk, Little Grizz? Even you, Sasako?!

129.speaker: grizzly
129.character: ったく しようがねえな
129.definition: Damn it. Looks like I have no choice.

130.speaker: aligator
130.character: テキーラ グリちゃん

131.speaker: grizzly
131.definition: I ain't going to let you get away with that!

134.speaker: grizzly mama
134.character: おやすみ グリちゃん

135.speaker: sasako
135.character: え タイムカプセルですか

136.speaker: llama
136.character: はい 昔 自分宛てに出した手紙が届きまして
136.definition: Yes. I sent a letter to myself years ago, and it just arrived.

137.speaker: sasako
137.character: あっ もののけの森
137.definition: Wow! The Mononoke Forest! You left a time capsule there? Yes.

138.speaker: penguin
138.character: なんで 笹子さんが知ってるの
138.definition: How does Miss Sasako know about this?

139.speaker: polar bear
139.character: むかしむかし 昔笹子さんとラマさんは
139.definition: Long, long ago... Miss Sasako and Mr. Llama lived in the same city.

140.speaker: penguin
140.character: なんで 昔ばなし風
140.definition: Why are you saying it like an old folktale?

144.speaker: penguin
144.character: イントロクイズじゃないんだから
144.definition: This isn't a song intro quiz!

145.speaker: sasako
145.character: ラマさん 何を埋めたんですか
145.definition: What did you bury, Mr. Llama?

146.speaker: llama
146.character: それが もう覚えてなくて…
146.definition: The thing is, I don't remember at all.

147.speaker: llama
147.character: 明日 掘り返しに行くので 何が出てくるか楽しみです
147.definition: I'm going to go dig it up tomorrow, so it'll be exciting.

148.speaker: llama
148.character: シロクマさん お店はいいんですか
148.definition: What about the café, Mr. Polar Bear? Don't worry. The Café's other name is the Fickle Café.

149.speaker: puppet
149.character: それ ダメな気まぐれですから

150.speaker: polar bear
150.character: 笹子さん ミクロ系になったね

151.speaker: polar bear
151.character: 略して ミクロ笹子さんだね
151.definition: I guess shortened it'd be Micro Miss Sasako.

154.speaker: sasako
154.character: ペンギンさん やめてくれませんか
154.definition: Could you stop that, Mr. Penguin?

155.speaker: penguin
155.character: なんで 昨日 徹夜してまで作ってきたのに
155.definition: Why? Even though I stayed up all night making it?

156.speaker: panda
156.character: すごい 一夜づけだね

157.speaker: llama
157.character: ほめてませんね それ

164.speaker: polar bear
164.definition: So the five of us are all here.

166.speaker: guy
166.character: 網棚で寝るパンダなんてレアだな
166.definition: It's rare to see a panda sleeping in the luggage rack.

167.speaker: girl
167.character: ブログにアップしよう
167.definition: I'm totally uploading this to my blog!

168.speaker: penguin
168.character: 網棚で寝るパンダが 検索ワードランキングで急上昇してるよ
168.definition: Searches for "Panda sleeping in the luggage rack" is are spiking across the Internet.

169.speaker: polar bear
169.character: パンダ君をペンギンさんと回収してくるから
169.definition: I'll go fetch Panda with Mr. Penguin,

170.speaker: polar bear
170.character: ラマさんと先に行ってて
170.definition: so go on ahead with Mr. Llama.

171.speaker: sasako
171.character: はい じゃあ ラマさん…

172.speaker: llama
172.character: ベンチの下で寝るラマはいかがでしょう
172.definition: How about a llama sleeping under a bench?

173.speaker: penguin
173.character: じゃあ 旅の記念に１枚
173.definition: Well, I guess I'll take oneto remember it by.

176.speaker: llama
176.character: クリームパン 葉っぱの形は昔のまんまですね
176.definition: Looks like the cream bread is still shaped like a leaf. Since we're here, how about we buy five of them? Five of them?

177.speaker: sasako
177.definition: Enough for everyone! So the swings were this small...

178.speaker: llama
178.character: 昔は 僕も余裕で乗れたんですけどね
178.definition: I used to be able to sit on it  without any problem, too.

179.speaker: sasako
179.character: どうやって乗ってたんですか
179.definition: How did you sit on it?

180.speaker: llama
180.character: ご想像にお任せします
180.definition: I'll leave that up to your imagination. Wow, that's amazing, Mr. Llama!

181.speaker: sasako
181.character: 昔も砂場が好きだったんですか

183.speaker: llama
183.character: いつの日か サグラダファミリアを造るのが目標です
183.definition: My goal one day is to make the Sagrada Família. I see...

186.speaker: raccoon
186.character: ああ 浜の湯の裏に住んでた
186.definition: Oh! The one that lived behind Hama no Yu.

188.speaker: raccoon
188.character: 迷子で有名な 笹子ちゃん
188.definition: Sasako who was famous for getting lost!

189.speaker: sassako
189.definition: Yes... Didn't you end up going over to the next city

190.speaker: raccoon
190.character: 隣町まで行っちゃったのよね
190.definition: because you wanted to see the wind station's turbine up close?

192.speaker: raccoon
192.character: ちゃんとやってる アンタ放浪癖があるから
192.definition: How ya been? You've always had a habit of wandering off

193.character: 昔から 心配してたのよ
193.definition: so I always worried about you.

195.speaker: llama
195.character: どうも お久しぶりです

197.speaker: llama
197.character: いつも アライグマさんに怒られて

198.character: 洗い物をさせられた ラマです
198.definition: always yell at and make help you clean.

201.speaker: llama
201.definition: It's been a while. Well, haven't you calmed down a bit? I may not look it, but I'm an adult now.

202.speaker: raccoon
202.character: でも 落ち着きすぎて
202.definition: But you've calmed down so much, you look rather dull now.

203.speaker: sasako
203.character: アライグマさんの毒舌 変わりませんね
203.definition: Ms. Raccoon's sharp tongue hasn't changed.

205.speaker: llama
205.character: まるで 時間旅行で
205.definition: It's as if we've time traveled back to the town from our memories.

206.speaker: sasako
206.character: ラマさんって ロマンチストなんですね

208.speaker: polar bear
208.character: 笹子さん どこにいるの

209.speaker: polar bear
209.character: なかなか来ないから お風呂に入っちゃったよ
209.definition: You were taking a while, so we decided to take a bath.

211.speaker: penguin
211.character: たまにはあったかいお風呂もいいよね
211.definition: A hot bath is great once in a while.

212.speaker: polar bear
212.character: 笹子さん なつかしいでしょ

213.speaker: polar bear
213.character: ひとっ風呂 浴びてきなよ
213.definition: Why don't you have a quick bath? No, I'm fine...

214.speaker: penguin
214.character: 結局 何を埋めたか思い出せないまま
214.definition: So you still can't remember what you buried?

216.speaker: sasako
216.definition: Maybe it was a clay figure.

217.speaker: penguin
217.character: ハズレに１万トゥグルグ賭けるよ
217.definition: I bet 10,000 tugrik that it's not.

219.speaker: penguin
219.definition: I think they might have expired...

221.speaker: penguin
221.definition: You're thinking of Tokugawa. My heart is beating fast.

222.speaker: sasako
222.character: みんな もうすぐですよ

223.speaker: sasako
223.character: そこの角を曲がれば もののけの森です
223.definition: As soon as we turn the corner... It's the Mononoke Forest.

224.speaker: penguin
224.character: これじゃあ タイムカプセルは掘り返せないね
224.definition: Probably not going to be able to dig up the time capsule now.

225.speaker: sasako
225.character: 一本杉だけ残したんですね
225.definition: Looks like they left the cedar.

226.speaker: llama
226.character: あの下に埋めたんですが

230.speaker: polar bear
230.character: 素朴な味わいがいいね
230.definition: The simplicity of the taste is great.

231.speaker: sasako
231.character: カスタードクリームがたっぷりでしょ
231.definition: There's a lot of custard cream in it, isn't there?

232.speaker: llama
232.definition: The taste hasn't changed at all.

233.speaker: panda
233.character: なに スーパーマン

235.speaker: sasako
235.character: ほら あそこに風車が見えるでしょ
235.definition: Look. You can see the windmill, right?

236.speaker: sasako
236.character: あれ 思い出の風車なんだよ
236.definition: That's a very memorable windmill to me.

237.speaker: penguin
237.character: ラマさん 残念だったね
237.definition: It's too bad though, Mr. Llama.

239.speaker: llama
239.character: でも 久しぶりにこの町に来られたので よかったです
239.definition: But it was great just being able to come back here.

242.speaker: badger
242.character: どうも 遅くなりました
242.definition: Hello! Sorry for taking so long.

243.speaker: polar bear
243.character: 頼むね アナグマ君

244.speaker: badger
244.character: 穴掘りなら任せてください

246.speaker: llama
246.character: よろしくお願いします

249.speaker: polar bear
249.character: 出た 徳川の埋蔵金
249.definition: Did you find it? Tokugawa's buried treasure?

250.speaker: penguin
250.character: 埋蔵金だったら 糸井さんが悔しがると思うな
250.definition: I'm sure Mr. Itoi would be disappointed if it was found.

252.speaker: panda
252.character: イトイさん ミズノさん

253.speaker: sasako
253.character: パンダ君 いらない知識だよ

256.speaker: sasako
256.character: 何が入ってるんでしょうね

260.speaker: polar bear
260.character: 今が旬の アミガサタケのクリームパスタ どうぞ
260.definition: Here's some pasta with cream sauce, with seasonal mushrooms. Eat up.

261.speaker: badger
261.character: キノコ大好きです いただきます
261.definition: I love mushrooms! Thank you for the food!

263.speaker: penguin
263.character: 志ん生だよ きっと

266.speaker: llama
266.character: 聴いてみての お楽しみです
266.definition: We'll just have to listen and see.

267.speaker: sasako
267.character: シロクマさん これですか
267.definition: Is this it, Mr. Polar Bear?

268.speaker: polar bear
268.character: ありがとう よく見つけたね
268.definition: Thanks. I'm surprised you found it.

269.speaker: polar bear
269.character: じゃあ 再生するよ

270.speaker: llama
270.character: 「ラマママ リャママラミャ ラッミャママミャラマンボー」
270.definition: {\a6}Llama ma ma, llama ma ma, llama ma ma ma... {\a6}Llamambo! {\a6}Llama ma ma, llama ma ma, llama ma ma ma...

272.speaker: llama
272.character: 僕が作詞作曲しました
272.definition: It's a song I wrote. They called me the Third Avenue Mozart when I was a kid.

274.speaker: penguin
274.character: シロクマ君 カフェモカおかわり
274.definition: Could I get another café mocha, Polar Bear?

275.speaker: panda
275.character: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

277.speaker: panda
277.character: 僕のかわいいに いつ補償金が出るかな
277.definition: When do you think I'll get a subsidy for my cuteness?

278.speaker: penguin
278.character: たぶんぜっと出ないかな

279.speaker: panda
279.character: じゃあ二百円あげるから二万円ちょうだい
279.definition: Okay, then I'll give you 200 yen, so could you give me 20,000 yen in return?

280.speaker: penguin
280.character: その取り引きでyesと言う地球人はたぶんいないかな
280.definition: I don't think anyone on Earth would say yes to that trade.

281.speaker: sasako
281.character: お汁粉とぜんざいで何が違うですか
281.definition: How are red bean soup and red-bean soup different? We can discuss that later.

282.speaker: penguin
282.character: シロクマくん 終ろ

283.speaker: polar bear
283.character: 来週のシロクマカフェイ二十四時は
283.definition: Next week's Polar Bear Café 24 o'clock...

284.speaker: penguin
284.character: 最終回も普通に予告しないんだね
284.definition: Not gonna even announce the last episode correctly, huh?
